review: I've got severe anxiety (GAD, SAD, OCD, Panic Disorder) and have been taking this med for the past 4-5 months. I'm also taking this for my depression. Currently I'm taking 175mg. Since I'm not an adult it's only recommended I take up to 200mg, so I'll likely go to there with my psych's advice. To be honest, this is one of my least favourite meds (I've tried zoloft/sertraline, mirtazapine, bupropion, venlafaxine, quetiapine). Since taking this, I've noticed a sharp increase in panic attacks and over all higher levels of anxiety, and a higher need to do my compulsions. I've missed two weeks of uni and also my job which I absolutely love because of the anxiety. My parents tell me I seem even more sad, and it's even harder for me to shower and brush my teeth. Honestly, fluvoxamine just makes me feel bad, but I know it works great for others. Just goes to show everyone is different! Luckily I haven't had physical side effects like vomiting. I also take trazodone 50mg for sleep.

Originally I was prescribed this for social anxiety disorder. I do feel like it helped with managing intrusive thoughts/anxious feelings when my SAD was worse, but because of therapy and perhaps the help of the med I don’t have that anymore. I struggle more with the occasional depressive episode now and I find that 100mg of this doesn’t really do much of anything for that. However, I haven’t experienced any side effects except for clenching my teeth more.
the Fluvoxamine is a good one to try for social anxiety disorder. It washed out my anxiety almost completely. Less withdrawals than venlafaxine, Desvenlafaxine and fluoxetine
Fluvoxamine is the only medication that worked for my social anxietyWhen everything seemed hopelessLuvox helped me restore my social life and my life in generalI love luvox thank you
Luvox CR (fluvoxamine):Luvox is very effective for social anxiety disorder....

This drug has been amazing for me. I was taking klonopin too often trying to control anxiety. This drug took a while to work - but now that it has - it has been a life saver for me. Lost some motivation with it so MD prescribed Wellbutrin for mornings to help with that side effect. Works like a charm.

I took Luvox for over a year at a low dose.  I decided that I should try being off of it, and I took a VERY long time to work my way off of it slowly, decreasing by 50 mg after a week at each step down.Even so -- I experienced something that I would call "flashbacks" for almost 18 months after stopping the medication.  It was the most scary thing I ever experienced, and I had no control as to when it would happen -- and it often happened at work or while driving on the commute home (I would pull over and try to get myself together, it was horrible).    Needless to say, I never want to take this drug again.  I was surprised when the MD who prescribed it said that he thought that the flashbacks were because I needed the medication.  No way.

Luvox CR (fluvoxamine):I was taking 300MG of this medication for almost 1 year. I stopped taking it for about 4 months because I wanted to see how I would feel being medication free. I faced withdrawal symptoms for 1-2 weeks after suddenly quitting from 300MG to nothing. The withdrawal symptoms weren't severe at all. During the time when I was on it, I had peace of mind. I can't describe the experience other than I felt so good that I have decided to start taking it once more. I suffered from Social Anxiety, OCD, and extreme depression.
